title.native: ハートキャッチプリキュア!

description:
2nd year middle school student Tsubomi Hanasaki has just moved with her family to the town of Kibougahana to live with her grandma. She is shy and introverted, but is determined to start off her new school life at Myoudou Academy as confidently as possible.

Lately she has been having the same mysterious dream again and again, of Cure Moonlight's defeat at the Great Heart Tree. She wonders what it all means. Then suddenly, two fairies from the dream appear to her, and before she knows it, she is transformed into the legendary Pretty Cure, Cure Blossom!

Later joined by her high energy classmate and new friend Erika Kurumi as Cure Marine, the two girls vow work hard to protect everyone's Heart Flowers from the evil gang, The Desert Messengers.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Kids
tags.description: Target demographic is young children.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Fashion
tags.description: Centers around the fashion industry.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Fairy
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a fairy.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/東堂いづみ) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Izumi_Todo)

Izumi Toudou is a collective pseudonym for [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s staff.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nassy_takanashi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nassy_takanashi/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/64mecceQewFCKwCK6JBW0o)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ushimou730) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/馬越嘉彦)

A highly prolific and respected character designer.

Originating from Monsieur Onion, where he spent his in-betweening days studying under [Hirotoshi Takaya](https://anilist.co/staff/117473/) and [Junichi Hayama](https://anilist.co/staff/140660/). In 1991, he moved to Studio Cockpit with [Hisashi Kagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120432/) and [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/). A few years later he debuted as a character designer on [Grappler Baki](https://anilist.co/anime/1859/) in 1994.

He is said to be a very fast and efficient worker, and according to himself, he much rather participates in TV productions than theatrical ones. Close friends with [Hiroshi Nagahama](https://anilist.co/staff/99346/) whom he often works with. They first worked together on [Juubei-chan 2](https://anilist.co/anime/636/), for which Umakoshi provided the designs for and served as the chief animation director on all 13 episodes. The following year, the duo teamed up again for [Mushishi](https://anilist.co/anime/457/), which's production quality was unusually high for a TV production. Umakoshi designed the characters and worked as the chief animation director on all 26 episodes of the series and hit a burn-out. After this he took a step back on major roles for a few years. Both him and Nagahama reprised their roles on Mushishi's revival in 2014.

In 2016, Umakoshi was appointed as the character designer on [My Hero Academia](https://anilist.co/anime/21459/), and has since been highly involved with the series' production as both an animation director and animator.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大田和寛)

Freelancer with former ties with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/) and [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sushio_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sushiogumicompany/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%99%E3%81%97%E3%81%8A)

Ishizaki Toshio, better known as Sushio, is an animator, illustrator and character designer working for [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/).

After graduating from Yoyogi Animation Academy, he joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). He debuted as an in-betweener in [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/), as a key animator on [Berserk](https://anilist.co/anime/33/), and as an animation director on [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/276/). In 2007, he served as a character designer for the first time on [Kiss Dum: Engage Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/2106/). He was a key staff member at Gainax for a long time, but left in 2011 when [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/) and others established the anime production company Trigger. There he was given the job of handling the character designs for [Kill la Kill](https://anilist.co/anime/18679/), the first TV series produced by the newly-found studio.

Specializes in action and effects, and his skills attract a lot of attention in the industry.

Took part as a key animator on Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" in 2003.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/548921222)

A freelance animator most known for his work on the various Toei Animation series. His animation cuts tend to include amazing visual effects with a very high frame rate, and can be recognized from various signatures. From hand-drawn smoke effects, to debris & background animation, Shida specializes in very dynamic action sequences, flying sequences, and various cuts on multiple anime openings.

Mayu Kudou is a Japanese singer. Since performing the opening theme of [Yes! Precure 5](https://anilist.co/anime/1932), she has been a prominent voice in the Precure franchise. She was in Jazz Vocal Unit called Harajuku BJ Girls (Chix Chicks) in 2005-2010.
She has sung the theme song for the anime Heartcatch Precure! and is also a member of the female pop group C-ZONE.

[1st Twitter](https://twitter.com/NishiiTerumi) | [2nd Twitter](https://twitter.com/Nishiiterumi1) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/teruminishii.bsky.social) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRVXG5v77o6zvzBxb9NxffQ) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/terumi_nishii/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=17680136) | [Website](http://studio-meiris.com/)

Initially wanting to become a mangaka, it wasn't until while studying at Osaka Designers' College that Ishii thought about becoming an animator after having seen [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/), a show directed by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/). Shortly thereafter a re-telling movie for the series was announced and Nishii set her sights on being part of the production. After graduating she joined Studio Cockpit and managed to make her debut on the film as an in-betweener.

In 2011, she made her debut as a character designer on [Penguindrum](https://anilist.co/anime/10721/), another show of Ikuhara's.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/129893119)

Tatsuya Nagamine is an anime director affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).
Affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).
Affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).
Affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oja0222digi)

Affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) since 1987.

[Seki-sensei](https://anilist.co/character/14098/) in [Ojamajo Doremi](https://anilist.co/anime/350/) is named after her.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzumevachi)

Freelancer formerly affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/).

Close friends with [Rie Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/107664/), and the two often work together.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/青山充)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/青山充)
An animator and director working for Toei Animation.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/うえだひでひと)
